brewery.brewery_description:
We at Partizan relish diversity. We delight in the cultural richness of our surroundings here in London, with its myriad ethnicities, languages and traditions. A city, fueled by passionate, creative and enterprising people, drawing on a wealth of strands of history and identity, filled with excitement to create anew. Hence the name 'Partizan' - a strong belief in the preservation of identity and knowledge of the great strength and beauty that lies in the juxtaposed co-existence of differing ideas and ideals.

An area famed for its brewing heritage, Bermondsey has been our home since the outset, and we have sought to show our respect for the great beer that was made here some generations before our arrival.

beer.beer_description: Speyside barrels

items.badge_description: Strong, bold flavors really suit you. The barleywine brings with it a long history dating all the way back to ancient Greece. That's 25 different Barleywine, Wheat Wine Beers or Rye Wine! Try 5 more for Level 6!

user.bio: Life's too short to NOT drink fresh beer. IG ➡️@Shake.Your.Hips

beer.beer_description: New England because of the way we use hops and the amount added. Also partly the way we treat our water and the texture of the final beer. The texture is the most interesting part of this beer as it’s also very delicate and dry, owing to the yeast used. The saison yeast biotransforms a lot of the hop oils to give a complex and full aroma and flavour much different than a NEIPA. First started as a collaboration with the good guy squad at Pressure Drop and altered slightly to become an occasional beer we will put out from time to time with different hop combos. This one is single-hopped with Idaho 7

items.badge_description: You have a keen taste for this Belgian masterpiece. Did you know the Saison style beer was invented by Belgian farms, brewed in the Winter and served the Spring/Summer to all their workers? Well now you do! That’s 10 different Farmhouse Ales! Try 5 more for Level 3.

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 375 check-ins at venue that is verified.  Try 5 more for Level 76!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 225 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 46.

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 155 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 32!

The texture is the most interesting part of this beer as it’s also very delicate and dry, owing to the yeast used. The saison yeast biotransforms a lot of the hop oils to give a complex and full aroma and flavour much different than a NEIPA. First started as a collaboration with the good guy squad at Pressure Drop and altered slightly to become an occasional beer we will put out from time to time with different hop combos. items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 225 distinct venues!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 270 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 55!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 80 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 17.

Whether you’re having a room party or hanging at the hotel bar, you know the essential part of any trip, an awesome beer!

That's a beer at 20 different venues categorized as a Hotel! Visit 5 more different ones for Level 5!

This is the normal stout this is not the Foreign Export Stout (FES).

The texture is the most interesting part of this beer as it’s also very delicate and dry, owing to the yeast used. The saison yeast biotransforms a lot of the hop oils to give a complex and full aroma and flavour much different than a NEIPA. The ABV for this beer varies but the recipe remains the same.

It pours a hazy pale yellow color with a small white head. Aroma is lightly grassy grainy and quite acidic. Notes of citrus, white grapes, hay and yeast. Taste is light grainy, light sweet, medium acidic with notes of melon, citrus peel, hay and grass. Light body with lively carbonation. Overall, really tasty and refreshing.
The ABV for this beer varies but the recipe remains the same.

Rainbow Project 2017, orange. Collaboration with New Belgium. Saison with spruce tips and experimental hop 522. We have orange and green – This year is orange so we thought about the idea of the destruction of nature and the rebirth of it such as a phoenix or fire destruction leading to regrowth. The area where the spruce tips were sourced is called Pagosa Springs, Colorado. It’s in the San Juan Valley. Super gorgeous area. About four years ago, this area experienced terrible wild fires that were referred to as the West Fork Complex.  About 109,000 acres burned. So this area is experiencing a ton of rebirth and growth after that fire. The new trees aren’t mature enough yet to produce the quality of tips we used , but there’s a rejuvenating story to be told there that all stems from fire.
Kaffir lime, lemongrass and grapefruit zest saison.
Beer brewed for the International Rainbow Project 2016. This is the 'Violet' beer - a Barley Wine with Riesling juice.
The ABV for this beer varies but the recipe remains the same.

We more than doubled our standard Pale Ale's dry-hopping rate to deliver a bolder, juicier, and hazier beer. Using Simcoe, Amarillo and Citra dry hops to help layer this pale with punchy tropical and resin notes.
Pale in colour, delicate mouthfeel. Aromas and flavours of fresh lychee and rose water. Soft, dry bitter finish.
The ABV for this beer varies but the recipe remains the same.
A hazy golden IPA with sweet oranges dominating. Aroma and flavour of malt & grapefruit leading to a bitter finish. ABV may vary.
Gold in colour, delicate mouthfeel and bitterness. Well balanced biscuit-like sweetness.
Gold in colour with a light body. Ripe orange, lemon, grapefruit nose. Citrus pith and mango with a clean, crisp bitter finish.
